comment: The static methods create and create_started provide convenient ways to create new instances of the StopWatch class, either in an unstarted state or with the stopwatch already started.

The code is well-structured and organized, with clear division of responsibilities into appropriate methods and attributes. The use of inner classes for enums enhances the readability and maintainability of the code.

Each method is thoroughly documented, outlining their purpose, parameters, return values, and possible exceptions. The use of type hints in the docstrings is beneficial for code readability.

The class effectively handles different states for the stopwatch, including unstarted, running, stopped, and suspended states. The error handling for illegal state transitions is well-defined.

The methods related to time measurement, such as get_nano_time, get_split_nano_time, get_split_time, get_start_time, get_stop_time, and get_time provide clear and consistent functionalities for accessing different time values and measurements of the stopwatch.

The error handling and raising of specific exceptions when the stopwatch is in an illegal state or when certain operations are called at inappropriate times are robust and help maintain the integrity of the stopwatch.
